Categorize Beta Distribution K Values

Source: R/Modeling.R
CategorizeK.Rd

Categorizes a numeric K value (e.g., from a beta distribution) into bins based on its sample quantiles.

Usage

CategorizeK(K)

Arguments

K

Numeric vector. The K values to categorize.

Value

Integer vector of categories, with possible values 50, 100, 200, 300, corresponding to increasing quantile bins.

Details

The function computes quantiles of K (using default quartiles), then assigns each value to a category:

  • 50: lowest quantile

  • 100: 2nd quantile

  • 200: 3rd quantile

  • 300: highest quantile

Examples

set.seed(1)
K <- rbeta(100, 2, 5)
CategorizeK(K)
#>   [1]  50 200  50 200  50 200 300 100 300 200  50  50 300 100 100 300 300 300
#>  [19] 300 300 200  50 300 100 100  50 100 200 300 100 200 100  50 100 100 100
#>  [37] 300 100 100 300 200  50  50 200 300 100 300 200 200  50 100  50 300 100
#>  [55] 100 300 200  50 200  50 200 200  50 300  50  50 200 100 200 200  50 100
#>  [73] 100 300  50 300 200 300 100 200 200 100 300 300 300 200  50 100  50 100
#>  [91]  50 200  50 200  50 300 300 200  50 100
